background.tribeDescription: The people living in the cities of the old world are commonly known as scavengers, or scavs for short. They are quite sceptical of outsiders of their small tribes, but form tight loyalties and friendships once they accept new blood. Scrap, doodads and trash is plenty in the ruins, so resources are plenty for crafting. Food, and drinking water is more scarce as the soil is bad for farming, and water usually floods then flows off. Stockpiled food also has a tendency to attract roidrats, jellies, or raids from Saurian tribes.

The people living in the cities of the old world are commonly known as scavengers, or scavs for short. They are quite sceptical of outsiders of their small tribes, but form tight loyalties and friendships once they accept new blood. Scrap, doodads and trash is plenty in the ruins, so resources are plenty for crafting. Food, and drinking water is more scarce as the soil is bad for farming, and water usually floods then flows off. Stockpiled food also has a tendency to attract roidrats, jellies, or raids from Saurian tribes.
background.occupationDescription: Makes clean water, has a strong stomach

background.tribeDescription: Life is difficult across the desert wastes of the new world, yet finds a way. The few resources here are under constant threat from brigands and bandits, due to their difficulty to protect, but also their value. Apart from raids, denizens of the wastes also have to deal with feral cacti, great antlions, and shellslugs, all dangerous wildlife. Old, heavily custom built motorized vehicles are the common way of transportation here.They are sturdy and can take the sand without a problem.
background.occupationDescription: Tends to crops, fights of cacti, outcast badass

background.tribeDescription: The offworlders came to earth from a far galaxy in a great ark, while searching for a habitable world, they crashed onto our planet and have been stranded since.
background.occupationDescription: Race of bioengineers. Long snout, many eyes, teal of skin

background.tribeDescription: Traveling the radioactive, toxic, and barren zones of the new world is a dangerous life. Here you find the bravest explorers, most pious believers, and a lot of mentally deranged people, as well as mutants and dangerous artificial demigods of the old world. The zone has neither clean food or water, but the most valuable, and curious artifacts. Venture too deep and you will find the Deadlands, where you will die to heavy radiation, test dummies, or the feared Chrome pyramid.
background.occupationDescription: Worships Pluton, god of extra appendages

background.tribeDescription: The offworlders came to earth from a far galaxy in a great ark, while searching for a habitable world, they crashed onto our planet and have been stranded since.
background.occupationDescription: Race of bioengineers. Long snout, many eyes, teal of skin

background.occupationDescription: Worships the great FM, makes quality content

background.occupationDescription: Knits tissue, sets bones, has morbid humor

EntityController.name: Pilgrim hadad in a lifepreserve
EntityController.description: Salt waste dwelling nomads. Pilgrims are usually bandits, and welcome strangers with bullets more often than not

actions.name: Vanish in the winds
actions.description: The pilgrim vanishes into the winds on successful DEX. Until the end of the round, or until they attack, they cannot be affected by any actions.

EntityController.name: City bear
EntityController.description: A mutated, intelligent bear. Only hunts for human if they must.

actions.name: Roar
actions.description: On a failed WIL enemies lose their movement and action in the first turn.

actions.name: Bear charge
actions.description: All bears on the same tile charge, moving twice the first turn

actions.name: Sharpen claws
actions.description: Swipe deals 1d6 extra damage, but bear cannot move

actions.name: Roar

EntityController.name: Demon spider
EntityController.description: An elusive menace, able to phase in and out of existance at will.

actions.name: Spit
actions.description: Allows melee attack to be ranged if stationary.

actions.name: Rappel
actions.description: Allows moving anywhere on the battleground at the end of round, at the expense of no actions or movement

actions.name: Phase shift
actions.description: When hit by Nuke, Ooze, Volt, Burst, or Gun, the spider phases out of existence, and is unharmed

actions.name: Poison gland
actions.description: If the stinger deals damage, on failed STR victim becomes poisoned
